descript.abstract:
Electoral district boundaries defined by the Nova Scotia House of Assembly, November 28, 2002, with the enactment of Chapter 34 of the Acts of 2002, An Act to Amend Chapter 1 (1992 Supplement) of the Revised Statutes, 1989, the House of Assembly Act.
Pursuant to Section 5A of the House of Assembly Act, boundaries amended May 20, 2004 with the enactment of Chapter 13 of the Acts of 2004, An Act to Amend Chapter 1 (1992 Supplement) of the Revised Statutes, 1989, the House of Assembly Act.
Name of Halifax Citadel was changed to Halifax Citadel-Sable Island by Chapter 17 of the Acts of 2008 amending the House of Assembly Act. Name of Bedford was changed to Bedford-Birch Cove by Chapter 18 of the Acts of 2008 amending the House of Assembly Act.
descript.purpose: Digital representation of electoral geography for Nova Scotia, used to support the electoral process.

idinfo.useconst: Elections Nova Scotia (ENS) grants to the user of this data set a royalty-free , non-exclusive use of the digital geographic data. The user has no ownership rights in the geographic data. Ownership of the geographic data and all intellectual property rights therein, if any, shall remain at all times with ENS. The user is authorized to use the geographic data solely for its own internal operation with respect to its specific needs. Reproduction or redistribution of copyrighted geographic data outside of user's organization or entity is expressly forbidden unless prior permission is granted by ENS.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

distinfo.distliab: In no event shall ENS have any liability whatsoever for payment of any consequential, incidental, indirect, special, or tort damages of any kind, including, but not limited to, any loss of profits arising out of use of or reliance on the geographic data or arising out of the delivery, installation, operation, or support by ENS
